result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray Thomas Steger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Ray Thomas Steger
Current: 105 Summit Street, Portage, WI 53901 United States  (Effective: 12-30-2014)
Prior: 203 S Water Street, Columbus, WI 53925

Cases heard: 14CM426 & 14CF381, Defendant Ray Thomas Steger in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived on Amended Complaint in 14CF381. Court went over the rights & elements.  Defendant plead no contest to count 2 in 14CF381. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 60 days jail, start Feb. 15, 2015 at 7 p.m.  Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08  $443 costs, sixty days to pay or set up payment plan with Clerk of Court. Ct. 1 read in and dismissed.  No jail credit.  Defendant plead no contest to count one in 14CM426. Court found guilty, imposed $673.50 fine, sixty days to pay or set up payment plan with Clerk of Court office.  Court granted 3 days jail credit.

Defendant Ray Thomas Steger in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF381 & 14CM426.  Matters are resolved.  Atty Lawton requested a new return date for plea/sentencing.  Bond remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Case heard: 14CF381 & 14CM426, Defendant, Ray Thomas Steger, appeared with Atty. Mark Lawton. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset requested.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 02:10 pm.  Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Long
